ygData.subject: Re: Bugs Re: [EverQuest] Digest Number 827
ygData.msgSnippet: Oh, I know. I kept emailing and calling and petitioning in game and got the same old same old. They finally just told me they had no clue what was wrong. I
ygData.messageBody:
Oh, I know. I kept emailing and calling and petitioning in game and got the
same old same old. They finally just told me they had no clue what was
wrong. I don't mind when they admit to not knowing. But I hate when they act
like I'm too stupid to have tried all the stuff.
Like when my modem died and I called my ISP to ask how to get a new one (I
require a specific modem for satellite that I have to get from a specific
source). 2 hours of repeating myself and explaining things to a tech who
talked to me like I was stupid and I convinced her that my modem really
*was* broken. It can be soo annoying sometimes. I was half tempted to tell
her that I had worked tech support at the navy and that I wasn't an idiot so
I could tell when a modem was broken.
There must be something in the programming that is overloading dialup...
They really should fix it. It's unfair to the dialup customers. Telling
someone to get dsl is bs bc some people can't get it.
luv,
-Su


> I remember back when I downloaded LoY and I had a dailup connection at
that
> time and I couldn't play for more than 5 minutes without the game booting
me
> off and having the screen YOU HAVE BEEN DISCONNECTED pop up. This
happened
> for about a week and a half until I got DSL. I asked the GMs and tech
> people for help but all they could tell me was everything on the everquest
> website. Prior to having downloaded LoY the game worked fine on my dailup
> connection, everything was ok. I gotta tell you some of these people who
> work at tech assist have no idea what they are talking about and they
don't
> listen to what you are saying. Well thats my 2cp.
>
> Dabruiser Troll
> Warrior of the 29th Season
>
